ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~   is experienced in:  Marketing; and Information Technology.    ~~~~~~   has 24 years of work experience.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Starting on 3/1/2006, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 16 months:
	Title: Account Executive/Pre-Press for NationWide Disc

Positions.Description:
Marketing Graphics Specialist
• Designed marketing campaigns across multiple advertising platforms.
• Designed marketing e-mail content.
• Manage social media sites and digital advertising
• Trade show planning, scheduling, delivery and vetting
• Design and layout multi-page product catalogs

• Design and produce on a variety of print and web materials
• Work with other Marketing and Dev team members closely to conceptualize and create designs
• Designed work for signage, t-shirts, tags, labels, and other promotional content.
• Managed outside print vendors (from bid to press check)
• Establish corporate brand standards
• Maintained a digital asset library

• Responsible	for	creating	production	ready	files, ensured	materials	maintained	graphic	standards, from	concept	to completion
• Generated	comps, creating	layouts, and	final	art	working	understanding	of	layout, type	and	color	and	create	a
completed layout.
• Produced	final	files	that	imaged	properly	in	regard	to	print	and	digital	formats.
• Provide support for the intranet and Internet redesigns.
• Managed content and requests for web publishing support.

• Prepared	client	data	and	graphic	files	to	output	on	printers	per	client	specification
• Utilized	specialized	software	tools	to	"merge"	data	to	specific	output	file.
• Produce high-resolution layouts, which will be used for press.
• Develop/Design internal corporate brands, supporting brochures, posters and direct mail campaigns.
• Act as creative studio for outside clients such as: Google, Wells Fargo, Blue Cross Blue Shield, and American Airlines

• Prepare for customer inquiries through knowledge of company products (Print/CD replication/CD duplication)
• Process orders in a timely and expeditious manner
• Direct design and production staff to ensure quality while working within deadlines.
• Perform proofreading checks on typographical, format and graphic elements
• Preflight	and	troubleshoot	digital	files, fonts, images	and	artwork
• Make suggestions on how to improve job processes and quality.

color system
• Operated	Agfa	image-setter	to	output	film	for	outside	vendors
• Made revisions to package design by preparing layouts, typing and copying text; creating and importing graphics
• Scanned	and	fixed	existing	logos	of	nation	wide	Optometry	offices	into	camera	ready	artwork	for	screen	printing
• Maintained a log of ink draw downs from outside vendors
• Collaborated in writing new Standard Operating procedures
8/96 to 12/01	• Experience in signage design, production installation.
• Created computer generated vinyl and/or full color graphics output that can be weeded, cut, and applied or
and mounted to a substrate.

ResumeMetadata.PlainText:
~~~~~~  
GRAPHIC DESIGNER
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   Euless, Tx 76040 |    ~~~~~~~   |    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   |    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
Skills:
•   Expert-level skills in InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator. Working knowledge with the rest of Adobe Creative Cloud suite
•   Expert	level	of	offset	print	production,	Pre-Press,	CMYK	separation,	RGB	color	spaces,	proofing,	and	digital	print	production.
•   Experience	with	package	design	and	production,	die	lines,	producing	ready	print	files	for	die	cutting
•   Data Merge Printing Software: FusionPro 8.2, GMC Inspire Designer 8.1
•   Basic Programing knowledge of HTML, CSS and basic structure of JavaScript applets.
•   Strong knowledge of Macintosh based equipment within a network environment.
•   Basic 3D rendering abilities for presentation
•   Superb illustrative skills with both traditional and digital
